page.title: 09Perth's European Links.
page.content: On a visit to {Perth Harbour}we dis- covered that trade between Perth and continental ports has increased due to the development of{shallow draught {ships}and Britain's entry into the {Common Market.}Last year 382 vessels docked there, mostly from Holland and Scandinavia. The harbour can berth 6/7 ships at a time. Commonest{imports}are animal feed, fertilizer, steel, cement, coal, coke, briquettes and some marble chips from Italy and Norway. The harbour {exports}include barley, seed potatoes, malt (for brewing)and barytes.Some new exports are logs bound for paper mills in Scandanavia. The most unusual cargo has been a boat-load of tinned rice. There are ten Dundee-based river pilots and it takes about 3 hours to sail up the{Tay}into Perth's {increasingly busy tidal harbour.
